message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms, including tender and foul-smelling lumps, suggest Hidradenitis suppurativa. This condition commonly affects the groin and axilla, making option (C) the most likely answer.

It commonly affects the groin, which is the most likely area to also be affected in this patient. The other options are not typically affected by hidradenitis suppurativa. The patient’s elevated fasting glucose concentration suggests she may have diabetes, which can be a risk factor for hidradenitis suppurativa.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms and history suggest hidradenitis suppurativa, which commonly affects the groin area. This condition is characterized by tunnels and abscesses that can cause foul-smelling discharge. Other areas of the body commonly affected include the axillae and buttocks, but neither of these options is included among the answer choices. Obesity and abnormal glucose metabolism are also associated with hidradenitis suppurativa.

The high fasting glucose concentration may indicate underlying diabetes, which can also be associated with hidradenitis suppurativa. The other options (forehead, central face, and shin) are not typically affected by this condition.

The presence of hirsutism and high fasting glucose concentration may indicate the presence of polycystic ovary syndrome, which can also have skin manifestations similar to hidradenitis suppurativa.
